reviewText: Highly recommend to teenagers and older.  Has some more adultish themes in it, so I felt it wouldn't be the best idea for my young ones.  The redemption story was great for this father of 6.
Title: Grace Unplugged

reviewText: An 18 year old girl has the dream of becoming a rock start. She and her father, (he's her real father, by the way) both play guitar and sing in their church. He used to be a professional singer but got out of that because of the demands being made on him to compromise his faith. But she makes up her mind to go into the music business despite his warnings. Watch this movie and see how it all turns out!
Title: Grace Unplugged

reviewText: Very good film. It's worth watching and made for a good family/teenage movie time. Reccomend for teenagers and Christians I was impressed.
Title: Grace Unplugged

reviewText: as the other reviewer said , I also wanted to like this movie, but I got 15 minutes in & found the conflict between parent & almost adult child to be what is always is. Yelling, going back & forth etc...A little too much generically, real to be entertaining. I parented teens,so been there, done that, don't need or want to revisit that ! I skipped ahead in the movie & the plot moved on predictably, which isn't necessarily a bad thing, but what was presented wasn't very engaging.Also, Oddly, there was the same song, over, & over, OVER again throughout the movie...& not one sung by the girl, but by a guy...the story is about, Grace, so they should have had at least a girl singer, especially since the actress playing Grace DOES sing ! The bulk of the story was a depressing cautionary tale, but you know there's a happy ending. I'd like to see a story about people who make good choices for the right reasons because they have seen what the consequences are second hand. A redemptive story is nice, but this seemed mostly depressing until the end. It's a 'movie'...which to be entertaining benefits from a mix of happy, sad, cautionary & upbeat, maybe a little fun thrown in... Entertainment with a moral, please!
summary: Good message & I support this kind of movie...but...
Title: Grace Unplugged

reviewText: One of the best faith based films we've seen. So nice to be able to watch a CLEAN movie with our children as a family that boasts on our great God. And Jamie Grace (one of our favorite family artists) being in it was a huge bonus. Watch it for yourself. :)

reviewText: I really liked the movie and thought it was great entertainment and message.  I have a son in a similar situation where he's leading a band and really loves it, but is torn about pursuing a college major that will provide a decent income upon graduation (vs. pursuing the lure of the music industry).  The movie illustrates the reality of what's really important and had me engrossed through to the end.

reviewText: This is a feel good film deep with Christian values.  Michalka is a good actress and singer and she truly conveyed the changing story of Grace and her family. reviewText: Great movie about how we choose to live our lives maters to the world and people in our lives. You either live for yourself only, or live for the people in your lives and make people more valuable then your personal dreams and aspirations. In the end it is the relationships (love) that live on this side of heaven, not fame, beautify and fortune.Good clean family entertainment that will provide teachable moments with your kids.
Title: Grace Unplugged

reviewText: This has a great theme. Has a great message about the lord and also about growing up and respecting those that have went ahead of you. You may not always agree with them, but they may know more than you think because they have been there done that.
Title: Grace Unplugged

reviewText: Grace is a naive teenager struggling to gain independence at any cost from her caring but protective father whom she loves but sees as an obstacle to her success. She flees from home and goes in pursuit of her dreams not caring for any one, even God whom she was raised to believe. She finally realizes that all that glitters is not gold and makes a decision to return to God and her family. A moving story for all family members to watch.
Title: Grace Unplugged

reviewText: I enjoyed this movie. A fun and entertaining movie. My wife and I just kicked back with a movie we new would not have vulgarity and sex throughout it. Great family movie.
Title: Grace Unplugged

reviewText: Wow, a wonderful spiritual uplifting movie. Well acted, directed, and performed by all.  Great insight into the corruption of fame and uncaring and parasitic hangers on in the entertainment business trying to get rich off of and use up other's talent for their own monetary benefit.  I recommend this for young and old alike, the theme is very important to all.
Title: Grace Unplugged

reviewText: The age old battle of teenagers and parents is not very different in a Christian home unfortunately.  Even those in ministry don't have a "magic formula" to raise their children and with all the outside influences these days it is a battleground much of the time because neither side is willing to actually communicate.  I found the movie very real because without seeing any situation through the eyes of Christ, it is a battle of flesh and blood and that is a losing battle.  But as soon as one can distance themselves and honestly accept their role in the problem and deal with it, God can and will bring restoration.  I gave it a high rating because it is entertaining but I also believe it has a message for families that can bring healing.
Title: Grace Unplugged

reviewText: This is a great balance for the ridiculous teen movies and shows that paint a picture of a perfect life as a teen star that just isn't true.  Glad to see something that balances the worthless dream shows starring the next child star to have a horrible adult life.
summary: This should be Required for all teens!
Title: Grace Unplugged

reviewText: Mainstream movie reviewers give this movie weak reviews while they sing the praises of Hollywood standard fare involving profanity, sex, drugs, blood, violence, and general perversity. This is a quality movie with a great and heartening message in the midst of a fallen and lost world. Good music as well. Christian movies like this one get the expected poor treatment by the MSM for obvious reasons, but blessings come through persecution - that we know. We also know that when a movie gets this kind of criticism from the world that the movie's message must be right on target after all. Keep on keeping on. There's a great prize that awaits. I highly recommend this movie, and am thankful for it and others like it. Keep em coming.I do want to add, though, that the only element I saw lacking in the movie came in the Christian characters frequently seeming to be shy in expressing and explaining their decisions and their faith to the non-believers in the movie. The dad, for instance, turning down the offer for a new recording deal without clearly explaining why to Mossy. Also, there were some missed opportunities to clarify for people the difference between religion and having a relationship with Jesus. Nonetheless the overall message of the movie was clearly expressed, and it is a very important one indeed. It still merits five stars in my view.
Title: Grace Unplugged
